headline: The Perfect Cinnamon Roll Icing
description: This cinnamon roll icing made with just the right amount of cream cheese makes the perfect sweet topping for your favorite homemade cinnamon rolls.

video.description: This icing is a go to for topping cinnamon rolls!
video.name: The Perfect Cinnamon Roll Icing

name: The Perfect Cinnamon Roll Icing

recipeInstructions.text: Beat butter and cream cheese together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until creamy.
Blend in milk and vanilla, then gradually mix in confectioners' sugar and salt until smooth and fluffy.

review.reviewBody: So easy and perfect. 5 minutes and done!
PERFECT! Loved it.
Awesome!!! Quick n easy!
This was perfect for our cinnamon roll bites!
This recipe was super simple and exactly what I was looking for. The icing added just the right taste and texture to my cinnamon rolls.
I made this and it was amazing!! I had to keep scraping down the bowl so it could get all mixed properly.
My husband absolutely loved it. I did add a little bit of cinnamon to it, since our family loves cinnamon.
AWESOME ✅ this though PUMPKIN SPICE instead of only cinnamon. Add both of these spices. PUMPKIN LOVERS y'all can Thank Me Later ☺️❣️
So easy to make! SO Yummy on cinnamon rolls! This is definitely a keeper! Don't sleep on this one folks!

I made this almost exactly as it was written. I waited until the end to see if I needed to add the milk and I did not.(I also didn't sift.) I used a small hand held mixer to blend it together. If I had tried to do it by hand (as I usually do with frosting), I may have needed the milk, but this way I didn't need it, so I didn't add it. My family loves this icing. It tastes so much like the cream cheese icing that comes with the packaged rolls. (In fact, I blended that in, too.) Definitely will be our "go to" because the kids always want more icing than comes with the rolls.
I recommend this recipe. Reminded me of the Cinnabon frosting/icing. Good on cupcakes too.
I left out the salt as I am on a low salt diet. I also used KerryGold Butter so it was a light yellow in color. It turned out very good! I will use this one again. Delicious!

We liked the sweetness level and viscosity of this icing. It dripped down the sides of the cinnamon rolls nicely without being runny. My main complaint is that it is definitely too buttery, which was evident by how yellow my icing was. I made it exactly according to the directions. Nex time, 'll try another recipe.
no changes. Good stuff!
Amazing frosting recipe! Can’t wait to make it again and again and again!!!
It was better than I thought it would be. I will be making it again and again for my Cinnamon Rolls.
Perfect icing. Easy to make and quick.
I’ve always used good maple flavoring instead of vanilla. It’s always been a huge hit.
Excellent recipe, perfect! Used this on the "Ninety Minute Cinnamon Rolls" recipe on this site, and it was a great combo. No more store-bought rolls or icing for us!
Really easy, absolutely delicious, recipe makes a ton of icing.
Perfection!!!!
Amazing
I made this exactly as written. It was very, very good in my opinion. PERFECT!
Absolutely delicious! I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out perfect. This is going in my cookbook for sure!
Amazing! I don’t know how this doesn’t have more reviews. I changed things up this time and added less powdered sugar so it had more of a thick batter consistency. Amazing. Amazing.
Just made this in a food processor exactly as written. Wow, don’t change a thing it’s perfect as is - fluffy creamy delicious! My cinnamon buns just went from great to greatest!!!
Maybe just a slash more of milk but was great!
A rich, delicious frosting made for our Christmas cinnamon rolls. I only used 6 T of butter.
Yum!! I added 3 oz cream cheese, then didn't add the last 1/4 cup of powdered sugar. Fantastic!!
Perfect for 90 minute cinnamon rolls. Easy quick and not too sweet.

Perfect for cinnamon rolls. This frosting is the best one I’ve ever tried to make. It tastes very similar to Cinnabon frosting. The only thing I added was a little bit of lemon juice. Very yummy and not overly sweet. I can eat a spoonful of this, I shouldn’t, but I do lol
Absolutely love this recipe

I have made this recipe for a couple of years now. It is perfect. 
A half recipe for a 9x13 inch pan of rolls is plenty of icing of my family. 
Leftover icing stores well in the fridge. 
Thanks so much for sharing this. 100% perfect.
Wonderful recipe! I have used this on cinnamon buns and apple honey cake - works great for both! It’s fast, easy and tastes great!
Impressed with creaminess but lacking in flavor slightly. I even added a few sprinkles of cinnamon while adding powdered sugar a cup at a time, as I doubled the recipe.
I made it vegan style using Cashew milk, plant butter and vegan cream cheese. I used it on Cinnamon Swirl Bundt Coffee Cake, vegan style, also found on All Recipes.
I thought this recipe was awesome . I've tried out several icings on my cinnamon rolls and this one was my favorite...my daughter's fave, too.
Yep! I love cream cheese frosting. This WAS the PERFECT amount!
My 4th time making this recipe. Love it!

This icing is perfect! Creamy and thick enough to stay put! Amazing flavor. Followed recipe without changing it up.

To De, who said this was thin and gloss-like... I cant comprehend this.
I made the icing exactly as the directions stated and it turned out fabulous.

This perfect cinnamon rolls 'icing' is too perfect for any changes! I did make it a little too fluffy this time, wanted to try it, but I prefer a little more creamy BUT the flavor either way is scrumptious!
It was ok. I felt u need to use less butter. I am going to try to use 2 oz of butter and 7 oz of cream cheese.
Its awesome! Didn’t change a thing. Covered one 9x13 pan of cinnamon rolls.
Perfect icing! Made a generous slathering for 12 large cinnamon rolls
Delicious and easy to make. It was wonderful!!
Great recipe! I used a food processor as I did not have my mixer on hand and it came out smooth and sweet.
absolutely LOVE this icing. so so so so good!
The really is the perfect cinnamon roll icing. Taste and texture are great. Just enough sweetness to complement a good cinnamon roll. Made enough for 24 standard-sized rolls.
I used a little more powdered sugar and no milk. Worked GREAT on my cinnamon rolls. Great flavor and held up well on the warm rolls.
I made this for on top of a Cinnabon Cinnamon Roll Cake. The cake was good, but this icing was "the icing on top the cake" - yummy!!!
Delicious! Not too sweet. For those trying to work through if it’s enough for 12 or 24 cinnamon rolls... it’s enough for TWO 13” x 9” pans. Cut the recipe in half if you’re not feeding an army. ??

This recipes has definitely changed my cinnamon rolls and made them even better! When only making 12 in a 13 x 9 pan I recommend halving the recipe. Overall though, this recipe is perfect and the cream cheese flavor does not over power the icing
This recipe is awesome, no other way to describe it. It is delicious, one of my family’s favourites, definitely a 5 star recipe.
Perfect icing for cinnamon rolls!
only difference was i had salted butter on hand so left out the salt addition. perfect balance of sugar/cheese/butter
Amazing!! creamy and tasty. This was great on my cinnamon rolls thank you for the easy recipe.
LOOOOOVED IT! NO NEED TO LOOK FOR ANOTHER!
Yup. It IS the perfect cream cheese icing, for ANYTHING! Could make thicker or thinner, glaze or carrot or spice cake icing. Or just lick the bowl.
Perfect as is

I usually don’t make or eat cinnamon rolls because the icing is way too sweet for me. I broke down and made some one day for my husband so I did a quick look up for an icing and found this one. I am so glad I made it, the cream cheese in this calms down the sweetness, I will be making cinnamon rolls more often now.

I made this to go along with the 90 Minute Cinnamon Roll recipe, and it was absolute perfection. I used a little bit of strawberry cream cheese, because I had some on hand, but it wasn't enough to really change the flavor. I might try using all strawberry cream cheese in the future or using orange juice in the place of the milk make orange icing. But it doesn't really need the extra flavor, it's amazing on its own!!
Not too sweet! Excellent frosting
I doubled the recipe. Great taste. Not too sweet or no overwhelming cream cheese flavor.

It's too soupy, I'll stick to the regular recipe.
For everyone else add more powder sugar and do not add the cream cheese.
Amazing icing!!!

This is by far the best cream cheese frosting I have ever had. In fact, I like it so much that I thicken it with more confectioner's sugar and use it on cupcakes. I hate buttercream so it's always good to find other icings that work, and I don't really care for too much sweet stuff but I can eat this icing by the spoonful.
Yum! I only had 2 cinnamon rolls, so I reduced the recipe down and didn’t make any substitutions. I will definitely be making this icing from now on!

Properly named! Perfect icing first try, and I even made a half batch! Made it to go on top of GF Cinnamon Rolls from a mix. Great taste! My family wants to spread the leftovers on cookies and crackers. Thanks!
Excellent icing. Just fantastic.
I made this recipe exactly as it’s written and it came out perfectly! It’s my go-to cinnamon roll icing recipe from now on!
Only change I made was using heavy cream in place of milk. I will make it again. Very rich and tasty!
Used this recipe for my first time making cinnamon rolls. Rolls were good, this icing was AMAZING! I made it exactly as written and loved it!
This recipe is AMAZING! I just made it for Christmas morning and everyone loved it.
Yes, it’s a little bit of work. I didn’t quite understand how rolling it out you should be. I added a little bit of not Meg to my sugar and cinnamon mixture .
The cinnamon rolls turned out perfect and the filling was amazing seriously good!! The icing was awful and tasted like cavities so I used a different recipe even still the recipe is delicious!

I love this recipe! I cut the recipe in half for some mini cinnamon rolls I made for my Christmas work party. It's so creamy, and the cream cheese adds some nice flavor. I also think it cut some of the sweetness of the confectioner's sugar. I will definitely make again!
No changes, it tastes so good! Cant wait for my Cinnamon rolls are finished baking! Yumm
Easy. Fast ... simple. Traditional!!!!
Great recipe. Easy to follow instructions. Thank you
Perfect! I had a lot leftover so I used it to frost my homemade banana bread. Delicious!
I made this to top on some cinnamon rolls. It was fast and easy. Also delicious on top told a warm roll! Yum!
Made it this morning, followed the recipe exactly as it was written and it is absolutely delicious! This will be our go to icing recipe! Thank you!!
I doubled the cream cheese as we prefer a more cream cheese flavoured frosting. As written you couldn't really tell there was even cream cheese in it.
The title says it all, this really is the perfect cinnamon roll icing. I’d even use this for other items as it’s just that good!
This is delicious icing! I’ll be making it again, for sure.

I used heavy cream instead of milk. Added a bit more vanilla extract. I had accidentally bought crescent rolls and family requested cinnamon rolls. I baked the rolls, but instead of twisting them into crescents, I left them flat so we could use the cream cheese icing. The rolls were a HUGE hit with the family! Every single roll was eaten! We had plenty of icing left over. I’m figuring out now how to use it and not waste that deliciousness! Very easy to make. I would have added more powdered sugar if I felt the icing was too thin, but it wasn’t. It came out perfectly. Easy to spread on the roll. Will melt some on hot rolls, but so will commercial icing. I will definitely be making this again. Thanks you for providing this easy and delicious recipe.
I am making it again to go on my sourdough cinnamon buns because it is the perfect topping!
Mine turned out way too thin so next time I will use less butter. It was still delicious though!
It really is perfect for cinnamon rolls!

I was making cinnamon rolls and realized that I didn’t have enough icing because someone had been licking the icing jar. So I clicked the first recipe I could find and this was even better than the jar that comes with the rolls. I used water instead of milk and it worked just as well.
My husband really liked icing because it wasn’t so sweet but myself and teens did not care for it
Yummy icing! I added a little maple extract and it helped give it a little more depth of flavor. Excellent!
Only thing I did that was different is i found out i had ran out of powdered sugar so i made some. Other than that the cinnamon rolls were delicious, my husband ate almost a whole pan by himself.

Fantastic recipe! I have used this three times now and failed once. Make sure you soften the butter not melt the butter or it will be a disaster. The flavor and consistency are perfect and it is now my go to recipe. Thank you for sharing!
It was delicious!!
made it as per the recipe. I think it's one of the best. Lighter than a cream cheese frosting but with just a touch of the cream cheese in the taste. Super tasty!
This is the BEST icing for cinnamon rolls! Frosted 12 large rolls with plenty for me to eat out of the bowl as well :-)
Delicious! I had Neufchâtel cheese so I subbed that, as well as Crisco instead of butter. Delicious!
